revised_title: Inelastic Collisions of Slow Electrons with Atoms: Theoretical Developments and Applications
tldr: This article presents a theoretical study of inelastic collisions between slow electrons and atoms, focusing on the effects of electron exchange and wave distortion. The authors develop a general theory and apply it to calculate excitation probabilities for hydrogen and helium atoms. The results provide insights into the behavior of electrons during inelastic collisions and help explain observed angular distributions of scattered electrons.
